description:
# Constructor Mastery

The `__init__` method is the constructor - it's called automatically when creating a new object. Master it to create well-initialized objects!

## The Constructor

```python
class Enemy:
    def __init__(self, name, health, damage):
        # Initialize properties
        self.name = name
        self.health = health
        self.damage = damage
        self.is_alive = True  # Default value
        print(f"Created enemy: {name}")

goblin = Enemy("Goblin", 30, 5)  # __init__ is called
```

## Default Values in Constructor

```python
class Player:
    def __init__(self, name, level=1):
        self.name = name
        self.level = level
        self.xp = 0  # Always starts at 0

p1 = Player("Hero")  # level defaults to 1
p2 = Player("Warrior", 5)  # custom level
```

## Your Quest

Create an Item class with validation:

1. Create class Item with __init__(self, name, value, quantity=1)
2. Set self.name, self.value, and self.quantity
3. If value < 0, set self.value = 0 (validation!)
4. Print "Created item: [name] x[quantity]"
5. Create Item("Potion", 50, 3)
6. Create Item("Cursed Ring", -10) and verify value becomes 0

Expected output:
```
Created item: Potion x3
Created item: Cursed Ring x1
Cursed Ring value: 0
```

# Create the Item class
class Item:
    def __init__(self, name, value, quantity=1):
        self.name = name
        self.quantity = quantity
        
        # Validate value
        if value < 0:
            self.value = 0
        else:
            self.value = value
        
        print(f"Created item: {name} x{quantity}")

# Create a potion
potion = Item("Potion", 50, 3)

# Create a cursed ring (negative value)
ring = Item("Cursed Ring", -10)

# Verify the cursed ring value was corrected
print(f"Cursed Ring value: {ring.value}")
